intro: Croton schiedeanus, commonly known as the Schiedea croton, is a tropical plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage. The plant typically features broad, lance-shaped leaves that can range in color from green to red and orange. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses around the world.
